intro: Scolymocephalus villifer, commonly known as the hairy scolymus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters and features finely divided leaves with a soft, hairy texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms in the summer months. Scolymocephalus villifer is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
